title: Authorizes nurse practitioners to certify that an immunization may be detrimental to a child's health
summary: Authorizes nurse practitioners to certify that an immunization may be detrimental to a child's health.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                          654

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                      (PREFILED)

                                    January 5, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M.  of  A.  GOTTFRIED  -- Multi-Sponsored by -- M. of A.
         BOYLAND, PHEFFER -- read once and referred to the Committee on Health

       AN ACT to amend the public health law, in relation to  who  may  certify
         that an immunization may be detrimental to a child's health

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Subdivision 8 of section 2164 of the public health law,  as
    2  added  by  chapter  994 of the laws of 1966 and as renumbered by chapter
    3  633 of the laws of 1975, is amended to read as follows:
    4    8. If any LICENSED physician [licensed to practice  medicine  in  this
    5  state]  OR  NURSE  PRACTITIONER  certifies that such immunization may be
    6  detrimental to a child's health, the requirements of this section  shall
    7  be  inapplicable until such immunization is found no longer to be detri-
    8  mental to the child's health.
    9    S 2. This act shall take effect on the ninetieth day  after  it  shall
   10  have become a law.





        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD02489-01-1
actClause: AN ACT to amend the public health law, in relation to who may certify that an immunization may be detrimental to a child's health
